alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 5:48PM EDT until August 12 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Franklin County in northeastern Georgia... Northwestern Elbert County in northeastern Georgia... Southern Hart County in northeastern Georgia... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 547 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Carnesville, or near Royston, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Royston, Bowman, Canon, Franklin Springs, Victoria Bryant State Park, Dewy Rose, Nuberg, Vanna, Bowersville and Rock Branch. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
